item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告受滚动冲击的世界经济前景暗淡
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）警告说，全球经济正显现出受到美国全面关税和保护主义影响的迹象—；尽管迄今为止，全球经济的表现要好于预期。【原文：The International Monetary Fund warned that the global economy is showing signs of strains from sweeping US tariffs and protectionism — even though it so far has held up better than expected.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）称英国面临七国集团中最严重的通胀和生活水平下降
item.description: 据国际货币基金组织称，尽管受到关税的影响，但今明两年英国的通货膨胀率将高于其他任何主要发达经济体，超过美国。【原文：Inflation will be higher in the UK than any other major advanced economy both this year and next, surpassing the US despite the impact of tariffs, according to the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 高盛以五部分交易拉开收益后债券销售序幕
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc. ）公布了创纪录的第三季度收入报告，成为美国六大银行中第一家在本轮盈利周期中举债的银行。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is the first of the six biggest US banks to raise debt in the current earnings cycle after the lender reported record third-quarter revenue.】

item.title: 前贝莱德高管力图重振多策略 ETF 赌局
item.description: 两位前贝莱德高管正带头进军规模虽小但发展迅速的 12.5 万亿美元交易所交易基金行业：多策略产品。【原文：Two former BlackRock executives are spearheading a push into a small but fast-evolving corner of the $12.5 trillion exchange-traded fund industry: multi-strategy products.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑为中国投资强制转让技术
item.description: 欧盟正在考虑，如果中国公司想在当地开展业务，就必须向欧洲公司移交技术，这是为提高欧盟工业竞争力而采取的一项积极的新举措。【原文：The European Union is considering forcing Chinese firms to hand over technology to European companies if they want to operate locally, in an aggressive new push to make the bloc’s industry more competitive.】

item.title: BCE 将节省 11 亿美元，向西扩展互联网服务
item.description: BCE 公司计划节省 15 亿加元（11 亿美元）的成本，并扩大加拿大西部和美国的家庭互联网服务，以恢复其在过去一年中股价下跌 26% 后的增长。【原文：BCE Inc. plans to save C$1.5 billion ($1.1 billion) in costs and expand home internet services in western Canada and the US to restore growth after its share price fell by 26% over the past year.】

item.title: 法国总理准备制定 2026 年预算案
item.description: Sebastien Lecornu 是 OCt.14.【原文：Sebastien Lecornu on OCt. 14.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油流量飙升至两年多来最高水平
item.description:
产量增加和乌克兰对炼油厂的袭击推动了出货量

。【原文：

Shipments have been boosted by rising production and Ukrainian attacks on oil refineries

】

item.title: 在美国要求中国首席执行官下台后，荷兰查封了耐克斯佩里亚公司
item.description: 根据荷兰法院的一份文件，在美国警告 Nexperia 必须更换其中国首席执行官才能不被列入制裁名单后，荷兰政府查封了该公司。【原文：The Dutch government seized Nexperia following a US warning that the chipmaker would have to replace its Chinese chief executive officer to stay off the sanctions list, according to a Dutch court filing.】

item.title: AMD 称甲骨文致力于广泛使用新型人工智能芯片
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices Inc.）是英伟达公司在人工智能处理器领域最接近的竞争对手，该公司表示，甲骨文公司将在明年大批量部署其即将推出的 MI450 芯片。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Nvidia Corp.’s nearest rival in AI processors, said Oracle Corp. will deploy a large batch of its forthcoming MI450 chips next year.】

item.title: 肯尼亚总统鲁托公布 310 亿美元基础设施投资计划
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托（William Ruto）宣布，计划在未来十年内斥资约 310 亿美元用于大型基础设施项目，一改此前控制支出和公共债务的承诺。【原文：Kenyan President William Ruto announced plans to spend about $31 billion over the next decade on large infrastructure projects, a U-turn on his previous pledge to rein in spending and public debt.】

item.title: 沙特 PIF 支持的 Salic 将寻求完全控股 Olam 公司
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，国有沙特农业与畜牧业投资公司（Saudi Agricultural & Livestock Investment Co.【原文：State-owned Saudi Agricultural & Livestock Investment Co. plans to pursue a full ownership stake in the agribusiness unit of Singapore’s Olam Group Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法院裁决后，被撤销的瑞士信贷AT1债券价格上涨
item.description: 瑞士信贷附加一级债券于 2023 年全军覆没，在瑞士法院裁定寻求损害赔偿的投资者部分胜诉后，与该债券相关的索赔价格迅速上涨。【原文：Prices on claims tied to Credit Suisse Additional Tier 1 bonds, which were wiped out in 2023, have risen rapidly after a Swiss court gave a partial win to investors seeking damages.】

item.title: 里夫斯暗示英国将限制开支，称需要削减债务
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）为英国下月的艰难预算奠定了基础，她告诉内阁同事，高借贷成本和债务水平意味着用于公共服务的资金将减少。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves laid the ground for a tough UK budget next month, telling cabinet colleagues that high borrowing costs and debt levels meant there would be less money for public services.】

item.title: 中东初创企业 "挑战地心引力"，创下筹资纪录
item.description: 数据平台 Magnitt 的数据显示，由于国际投资者为处于成长期的公司开出了更大的支票，中东地区的初创企业在上个季度创纪录地筹集到了 12 亿美元的资金，一反新兴市场资金崩溃的局面。【原文：Startups in the Middle East raised a record $1.2 billion last quarter, defying a collapse in broader emerging market funding, as international investors wrote bigger checks for growth-stage companies, according to data platform Magnitt.】

item.title: 芬兰将设立债务制动装置以修补濒临崩溃的公共财政
item.description: 芬兰将引入议会债务制动机制，旨在解决这个欧元区最北端成员国日益恶化的公共财政问题。【原文：Finland will introduce a parliamentary debt brake, aiming to fix the worsening public finances of the northernmost euro area member.】

item.title: Tonal 着眼于通过零售扩张和人工智能普拉提实现增长
item.description: 高端家用运动器材品牌 Tonal Systems Inc. 的首席执行官表示，公司已恢复收入增长，并正在扩大零售业务，这是公司扭亏为盈的最新尝试。【原文：The chief executive officer of the high-end home exercise equipment brand Tonal Systems Inc. said the company has returned to revenue growth and is expanding its retail presence in the latest attempt at a turnaround.】

item.title: Instagram 为青少年增加更严格的 "PG-13 "内容限制
item.description: Instagram 将禁止 18 岁以下用户观看被认为不适合 PG-13 级电影的内容，这是对去年推出的青少年保护措施的延伸。【原文：Instagram will prohibit users under 18 from seeing content considered inappropriate for a PG-13-rated movie, extending teen protections that were rolled out last year.】

item.title: 专家小组称印度需要 2 170 亿美元才能实现 2047 年核目标
item.description: 根据印度电力部小组周二发布的报告，印度将需要近19.3万亿卢比（约合2170亿美元）的投资，才能实现到2047年安装1000万千瓦核电容量的目标。【原文：India will require nearly 19.3 trillion rupees ($217 billion) of investment to reach its target of installing 100 gigawatts of nuclear power capacity by 2047, according to a power ministry panel’s report, published Tuesday.】

item.title: 顶级矿商称钴涨势有可能挤走电池制造商
item.description: 最大的钴金属开采商的一位高管表示，如果钴金属的价格因刚果民主共和国的出口限制而进一步走高，电池制造商将加速放弃使用钴。【原文：Battery makers will hasten a shift away from cobalt if the metal’s price — boosted by export limits in the Democratic Republic of Congo — goes even higher, said an executive at the biggest miner of the metal.】

item.title: 里夫斯的预算案使英国失去的工作岗位比想象中少了一半
item.description: 英国经济减少的就业岗位不及早先预计的一半，此前对薪资进行了修订，这有助于缓和对英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）首份重税预算案的批评。【原文：The UK economy has shed less than half as many jobs as earlier thought, after payroll revisions that could help temper criticism of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ tax-heavy first budget.】

item.title: NaturalCycles 酝酿新一轮融资，规模超过之前的 5500 万美元
item.description: NaturalCycles Nordic AB 是瑞典一家节育应用程序开发商，该公司正考虑明年启动新一轮融资，以拓展新市场并提高美国妇女的使用率。【原文：NaturalCycles Nordic AB, the Swedish developer of a birth-control app, is considering launching a new financing round next year as it looks to expand to new markets and boost use by American women.】

item.title: 从船舶到价差，越来越多的迹象表明石油过剩已经到来
item.description:
人们期待已久的全球原油市场供应过剩的证据正变得越来越具体。【原文：

Evidence of a long-awaited supply overhang on global crude markets is becoming more tangible.

】

item.title: 佩特罗佩罗债券从墨西哥一路逆风而来
item.description: 近年来，秘鲁石油公司（Petroleos del Peru SA）的债务问题一直困扰着投资者，但投资者的耐心正在得到回报，他们乐观地认为，混乱不堪的秘鲁政府将为其石油公司提供帮助。【原文：Patience is paying off for investors who stuck with debt from Petroleos del Peru SA through all the troubles of recent years, with optimism building that the government — as chaotic as it is — will aid its oil company.】

item.title: 摩根大通银行称，欧盟银行在非洲的撤退是当地贷款人的福音
item.description: 毛里求斯商业银行有限公司（Mauritius Commercial Bank Ltd.）表示，全球贷款机构从非洲大陆撤出，为这家印度洋岛国最大的金融机构在利基市场提供了增长动力。【原文：Mauritius Commercial Bank Ltd. said the withdrawal of global lenders from the continent is providing the Indian Ocean island nation’s biggest financial institution growth momentum in niche markets.】

item.title: 微软放弃 Windows 10 支持，数百万人仍在使用它
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，弗拉德-萨沃夫（Vlad Savov）和简-兰熙-李（Jane Lanhee Lee）将讨论微软面临的挑战，微软正在放弃对数百万人仍在使用的十年前软件的支持。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Vlad Savov and Jane Lanhee Lee address the challenge for Microsoft, which is dropping support for decade-old software that millions are still using.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷 AT1 撤销注销，部分投资者胜诉
item.description: 瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse Group AG）债券投资者提起诉讼，要求瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）在政府斡旋下解救该银行时造成他们的投资血本无归，瑞士法院为这起诉讼注入了新的活力。【原文：A Swiss court has breathed fresh life into a lawsuit filed by investors in Credit Suisse Group AG bonds seeking damages after their investments were wiped out when UBS Group AG rescued the bank in a government-brokered deal.】

item.title: 中美贸易战中，运输货物的船只被征收费用
item.description: 本周二，美国海关当局开始向中国建造和运营的商船征收费用，这些船只将货物运入美国港口，这是旨在遏制中国经济主导地位的一系列举措中的又一举措。【原文：US customs authorities began collecting fees from Chinese-built and -operated merchant ships bringing goods into American ports on Tuesday, one more move in a series aimed at curbing China’s economic dominance.】

item.title: 美国木材巨头同意合并，交易额达 71 亿美元
item.description: Rayonier 公司和 PotlatchDeltic 公司同意合并其业务，从而创建一家市值达 71 亿美元的美国大型林地所有者和木材制造商。【原文：Rayonier Inc. and PotlatchDeltic Corp. agreed to combine their businesses, creating a major US timberland owner and lumber manufacturer with a market capitalization of $7.1 billion.】
